content.rendered:
Boz learned from the teachers, who inspired her to make a positive difference in the world through education. Her law degree from the University of Wolverhampton, in English Law and the European Union Law, topped up her previously gained Master`s degree at a prestigious University in Poland, the Catholic Academy of Theology, current University of Stefan Kardynal Wyszynski in Warsaw. She has also gained the teaching qualifications PGCE (FAHE) at the University of Wolverhampton.

Since graduation, Boz has engaged in various teaching roles to contribute to society. Her experience started at Walsall College, teaching Law at GCSE, AS and A Levels for AQA and OCR, then engaged on subjects, such as English and Skills for Life, Employability and Financial Literacy. She has fully trained as an Adviser at the Citizen Advice Bureau in Wolverhampton. She hasalso gained experience in a private, public, technical, international commercial and charitable non-profit sectors. In advanced and supplementary educational settings, she trained in a foundation school governor role, chaired the curriculum and target setting committees and effectively directed a company and established her enterprise.

Currently, Boz teaches at Birmingham City University International College and the University in Bedfordshire, Law, Business Studies, Applied Social Sciences and Study Skills. She plans assessments and provides feedback for various subjects and liaises with the staff to deliver the best quality teaching to enhance learners` experience, attainment and motivation. She also volunteers at St. John Ambulance in a First Aider role.

With almost 20 years of teaching experience, Boz is very excited to contribute to Regent with her skills, dedication, diligence, and conscientiousness to unite with her learners to satisfy their needs, allowing them to achieve and grow into influencing entrepreneurs too.
